result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dejesus Juarez

defendant.name: Juarez, Dejesus
defendant.address: 645 W Scott St #207, Fond Du Lac, WI 54937

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dejesus Juarez in court without counsel.  Defendant states he will be able to reinstate his driver's license in February 2023.  State has no objection to an adjournment.  Court will set a hearing to check defendant's license status.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dejesus Juarez in court without counsel. Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant waives right to attorney.  Case passed.  Case recalled.  Defendant continues to waive right to counsel.  Defendant is not eligible to reinstate his driver's license until December.  Court sets $500 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
